intro: Fagara juglandifolia, commonly known as the holly fern, is a tropical plant native to Central and South America. It is a member of the Araliaceae family and is characterized by its compound leaves with a feathery appearance. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often in forest understories. Its leaves are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Fagara juglandifolia is also valued for its ornamental appeal due to its lush foliage.
